messages.subject: www.unschooling.com (was Re: Digest Number 747)
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, the forum, I guess... Definitely my favorite unschooling board... no offense to this list :) I guess I didn t realize that there was another
messages.messageBody:
Yes, the forum, I guess...

Definitely my favorite unschooling board... no offense to this list :)

I guess I didn't realize that there was another unschooling.com...But
I won't be going near it! Too many lists as it is!

Angie

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, SandraDodd@a... wrote:
>
> In a message dated 2/25/03 11:10:43 PM, angiehewerdine@m... writes:
>
> << I like this list, but I'd have to say that I like the WAY
> unschooling.com is set up. >>
>
> The forum you mean. I love it LOTS.
>
> I don't use the tree-thing, but I use "recent messages."
> I don't use the automatic kind. I back up an hour or so, so I'll
see my new
> stuff (if any) in context.
>
> Sandra

messages.subject: www.unschooling.com (was Re: Digest Number 747)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/25/03 11:10:43 PM, angiehewerdine@msn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/25/03 11:10:43 PM, angiehewerdine@... writes:

<< I like this list, but I'd have to say that I like the WAY
unschooling.com is set up. >>

The forum you mean. I love it LOTS.

I don't use the tree-thing, but I use "recent messages."
I don't use the automatic kind. I back up an hour or so, so I'll see my new
stuff (if any) in context.

Sandra
